item.title: Love what you do
item.description:
Love what you do

,,

“Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work. And the only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven't found it yet, keep looking. Don't settle. As with all matters of the heart, you'll know when you find it.” Steve Jobs

item.title: Imagination
item.description:
Imagination

,,

“Imagination is not only the uniquely human capacity to envision that which is not, and therefore the fount of all invention and innovation. In its arguably most transformative and revelatory capacity, it is the power to that enables us to empathize with humans whose experiences we have never shared.” J. K. Rowling

item.title: eforli survey
item.description:
eforli survey

,

Please complete this anonymous survey taking a look at confidence, innovation, around employment. If you're willing to discuss in more depth please write to info@practicalacts.org

,,

Thank you for your help! Check back for the results which will be available once we have enough responses.

item.title: New
item.description:
New

,,

“Because, you know, resilience - if you think of it in terms of the Gold Rush, then you'd be pretty depressed right now because the last nugget of gold would be gone. But the good thing is, with innovation, there isn't a last nugget. Every new thing creates two new questions and two new opportunities.” Jeff Bezos

item.title: Opportunity
item.description:
Opportunity

,,

“If you open up the mind, the opportunity to address both profits and social conditions are limitless. It's a process of innovation.” Jerry Greenfield

item.title: Execution
item.description:
Execution

,,

“Success doesn't necessarily come from breakthrough innovation but from flawless execution. A great strategy alone won't win a game or a battle; the win comes from basic blocking and tackling.” Naveen Jain
